data.event: The area was first settled around 1790.
The town was established in 1796 as "Pittstown," but was later renamed "Honeoye."
In 1815, the name was changed to "Richmond."

event.title: was added to Richmond from the Town of Canadice in 1836

data.event: More territory was added to Richmond from the Town of Canadice in 1836.
Parts of the Towns of Bristol and South Bristol were added to Richmond in 1848, but were returned to the source towns in 1852.

event.title: were returned to the source towns in 1852

data.event: Parts of the Towns of Bristol and South Bristol were added to Richmond in 1848, but were returned to the source towns in 1852.
In 1600 the Honeoye Lake Watershed was—apart from clearings made by Native Americans and natural causes such as fire, steep slope landslides, wind or ice—completely forested.
